title: Vinegared Cucumbers
ingredients: 6 cups peeled and sliced, seedless cucumbers
1 tablespoon minced fresh tarragon, or 1 teaspoon dried
instructions: In a stainless steel or enameled saucepan combine the vinegar with ½ cup water and bring the liquid to a boil.  In a large ceramic or glass salad bowl combine the cucumbers, the onions, the sugar, the tarragon, the salt and pepper and mix the ingredients well.  Add the hot vinegar mixture and toss the salad well and serve.
remarks: While the recipe results in a “hot” salad, I would prefer to cover the salad after adding the hot vinegar mixture and refrigerating it for at least an hour before serving.
source: Balloons Over Burgundy by Naomi Barry, Gourmet Magazine, August 1983.
